column1: Q1: What is the primary difference between traditional programming and machine learning?
A) Traditional programming uses data only, ML uses rules only
B) Traditional programming uses rules and data to get output, ML uses data and output to learn rules
C) Traditional programming learns by itself, ML requires explicit programming
D) Traditional programming and ML are the same
Q2: According to Tom Mitchell, when is a computer program said to learn?
A) When it is explicitly programmed for each task
B) When it can solve any problem without prior data
C) If its performance improves with experience on tasks measured by a performance measure
D) When it mimics human intelligence exactly
Q3: Which of the following is NOT a key component of machine learning?
Q4: Which of the following algorithms is mainly used for regression problems?
Q5: What kind of data does supervised learning require?
D) Any input data with unknown output
Q6: In supervised learning, what are the known outputs in the training data called?
Q7: Classification problems in supervised learning deal with:
C) Predicting discrete labels or categories
D) Finding rules in data without outputs
Q8: Which of the following is an example of unsupervised learning?
Q9: In unsupervised learning, data is:
C) Not labeled and no correct answers exist
D) Used only for classification tasks
Q10: What is the primary goal of reinforcement learning algorithms?
B) To maximize prediction accuracy with labeled data
C) To learn policies based on trial and error by interacting with an environment
Q11: Which algorithm below is a reinforcement learning example?
Q12: What kind of relationship does linear regression assume between input variables (x) and output (y)?
Q13: Multiple linear regression uses how many independent variables?
Q14: Which of these applications uses logistic regression?
A) Predicting the price of a house
B) Spam detection (spam or not spam)
C) Clustering customers by purchase behavior
C) Only discrete labels with no probability
Q16: The Support Vector Machine (SVM) algorithm aims to:
A) Find any separating line between classes
B) Maximize the margin between classes
C) Minimize the margin between classes
Q17: What are the closest data points to the hyperplane in SVM called?
Q18: In a soft margin SVM, what does the parameter C control?
A) The size of the dataset
Q19: Which optimization technique is commonly used to solve the SVM problem?
B) Lagrange multipliers and KKT conditions
Q20: Which of these is NOT an advantage of Linear SVM?
A) Works well in high-dimensional spaces
B) Sensitive to outliers in hard margin
D) Memory efficient (uses only support vectors)
Q21: Which of the following is NOT an application of SVM?
Q22: Which supervised learning model is used to estimate continuous values?
Q23: In classification problems, the labels in the training set are:
C) Categorical values representing different classes
Q24: Which supervised learning algorithm is suitable for binary classification?
Q25: Which statement about unsupervised learning is TRUE?
B) It discovers hidden patterns in data
C) It predicts future outputs based on past labels
D) It always provides discrete output labels
Q26: What is an example of an association problem in unsupervised learning?
C) Finding customers who buy both item X and Y
D) Classifying emails as spam or not
Q27: Reinforcement learning primarily uses which method?
C) Trial and error with feedback from environment
Q28: What is the purpose of features in a machine learning system?
B) To extract relevant characteristics from raw data
Q29: Which of these is a criterion used in evaluation of machine learning models?
Q30: Which algorithm below is most suited for classification of textual data like spam detection?
Q31: Which of the following best describes “training” in machine learning?
A) Applying a trained model to new data
B) Feeding data to the model to adjust its parameters
Q32: What does KNN stand for in machine learning?
Q33: What type of problem is “customer segmentation” an example of?
Q34: In linear regression, the line of best fit:
A) Maximizes the distance to points
B) Minimizes the sum of squared errors between predicted and actual values
Q35: In the given Python code for linear regression, what does `model.fit(X, y)` do?
A) Predicts values based on X
B) Trains the model on inputs X and outputs y
D) Creates features from raw data
Q36: What is the output of logistic regression when predicting?
B) Class labels or probabilities between 0 and 1
Q37: Which supervised learning algorithm would you NOT typically use for regression?
Q38: Which statement about decision trees is CORRECT?
A) They are unsupervised learning algorithms
B) They can be used for both regression and classification
D) They require input features to be clustered first
Q39: What is the main purpose of regularization in SVM?
A) To increase the training error
B) To control the trade-off between margin size and classification errors
D) To eliminate the need for support vectors
Q40: In SVM, what does a “hard margin” mean?
B) No tolerance to misclassifications; perfect separation required
D) Using soft clustering instead of classification
Q41: Which of the following metrics is NOT commonly used in evaluating classification models?
Q42: Which machine learning technique is best suited for detecting fraudulent transactions?
A) Supervised learning with classification algorithms
Q43: Which of the following is NOT an example of a supervised learning algorithm?
Q44: Which of these are common applications of machine learning in healthcare?
A) Disease diagnosis, medical imaging, drug discovery
B) Self-driving cars and traffic prediction
Q45: What does the term 'features' mean in ML?
B) The independent variables or attributes derived from raw data
D) The predicted label of the data
Q46: When is logistic regression preferred over linear regression?
A) When predicting continuous numeric variables
B) When the output is categorical/binary
C) When the data is unlabeled
D) For clustering similar data points
Q47: What kind of algorithm is Random Forest?
B) Ensemble method for classification and regression
Q48: What is the primary role of the training dataset in ML?
A) To label the test data
B) To build and train the model by adjusting parameters
Q49: In the context of supervised learning, what does "inference" refer to?
B) Evaluating the model on training data
C) Applying the trained model to new, unseen data
Q50: Which statement best summarizes the goal of supervised learning?
A) To find hidden structures in unlabeled data
B) To learn a mapping function from input x to output y based on labeled examples
C) To maximize rewards via trial-and-error interactions
D) To choose random output classes
